description: From far +‎ seer. Compare German Fernseher (“television”).

entries.meaning: (fantasy) One who farsees; prophet; soothsayer; fortuneteller.
examples: "I received word from the Farseer only this morning. They had been studying the motion of the central band in Brutus,  […]  "The men of the Farseer could not be mistaken?

entries.meaning: (fantasy, nonce word) An instrument or tool used to farsee; scope
